channel.title: Automation Rhapsody
channel.description: Website dedicated to test automation and development

item.title: Automating SignalR applications with Selenium WebDriver
item.description: This post is about a "No response from server for url" issue during automation of web application using SignalR with Selenium WebDriver. The issue was resolved by configuring the application to connect to the server through WebSocket protocol.

item.title: Efficient waiting for Ajax call data loading with Selenium WebDriver
item.description: This post is about implementing an efficient mechanism for Selenium WebDriver to wait for elements by execution of jQuery code.

item.title: Selenium WebDriver cannot click UTF-8 icons
item.description: Selenium WebDriver is not able to click UTF-8 icons. The solution is to use jQuery code.

item.title: Design patterns every test automation engineer should know
item.description: Description with examples of 5 design patterns that is good to know and use in our automation testing.

item.title: Singleton and Null object patterns
item.description: Description with code samples of Singleton and Null object design patterns.

item.title: Factory design pattern
item.description: Description of code samples of Factory design pattern.

item.title: Page objects design pattern
item.description: Description of code samples of Page Objects design pattern.

item.title: Facade design pattern
item.description: Description with code samples of Facade design pattern.

item.title: Automation of WPF applications
item.description: Overview how to successfully automate WPF application with Telerik Testing Framework and TestStack White.

item.title: Complete guide how to use design patterns in automation
item.description: Complete code example of how design patterns can be used in real life test automation.

item.title: WPF automation - projects structure

item.title: Running functional automation tests
item.description: .Unit testing frameworks are not very suitable for running functional tests. NTestsRunner is an alternative way of running functional automated tests.

item.title: WPF automation - running the tests
item.description: How to sell your automation to management. Guide for running the tests unattended.

item.title: WPF automation - locating and structure of WinForms elements
item.description: Guide how to locate WinForms elements with TestStack White.

item.title: Efficiently use of enumerations with string values in C#
item.description: Using enumerations or specialized classes makes your automation tests easy to understand and maintain. Show with code samples how to define and read string value to enumeration elements.

item.title: NTestsRunner
item.description: NTestsRunner is a tool for running functional automated tests.

item.description: NTestsRunner implementation details and features.

item.title: WPF automation - using the elements
item.description: Use already created Page Objects and build up test framework.

item.title: Multilingual automation testing with enumerations
item.description: Solution for automated testing of multilingual sites by using string values in all supported languages for enumerations.

item.title: Advanced WPF automation - page objects inheritance
item.description: re-use of page objects code through inheritance.

item.description: In this series of posts I'll expand the examples and ideas started in "Automation of WPF applications" series.

item.description: Example how to work with WinForms grid with TestStack White.

item.description: What is dependency property in .NET and how to read it from Telerik Testing Framework.

item.description: Automation SMTP Server is simple SMTP server run as console application.

item.description: Verify actual text with expected one by ignoring what is not relevant during compare.

item.description: How to do complete email verification with your own Automation SMTP server.

item.title: Advanced WPF automation - memory usage
item.description: Highlight eventual memory issue when using Telerik Testing Framework and TestStack White for desktop automation.

item.title: What about code coverage
item.description: Code coverage is a measurement of what percentage of program source code is being executed by your tests. Code coverage is a nice to have, but in no case make code coverage ultimate goal!

item.title: FIX messages simulator
item.description: General thoughts how to test FIX messages with a FIX simulator.

item.title: REST performance problems with Dropwizard and Jersey JAXB provider
item.description: Dropwizard's performance highly degrades when using REST with XML caused by Jersey's Abstract JAXB provider. Solution is to inject your own JAXB provider.

item.description: Describe what actions are needed in order to make successful performance testing.

item.description: How to send SOAP request over HTTPS in Java without generating and installing certificates. NB: This MUST not be used for production code!

item.title: What is The Test Mushroom and how to improve your testing
item.description: In contrast to Test Pyramid, Test Mushroom shows a test portfolio which is restricted to costly and slow UI tests only. In the current post, I will describe approaches to act on your Test Mushroom hence improve your testing.

item.title: How to gather code coverage with Istanbul and Selenium and pitfalls to avoid

item.title: Distributed system observability: complete end-to-end example with OpenTracing, Jaeger, Prometheus, Grafana, Spring Boot, React and Selenium
item.description: Code examples and explanations on an end-to-end example showcasing a distributed system observability from the Selenium tests through React front end, all the way to the database calls of a Spring Boot application. Examples are implemented with the OpenTracing toolset and traces are saved in Jaeger. This example also shows a complete observability setup including tools like Grafana, Prometheus, Loki, and Promtail.
